notes.text:
An update is now available for Red Hat build of Keycloak.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of
Low. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives
a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE
link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat build of Keycloak 24.0.5 is a standalone server, based on the Keycloak project, that provides authentication and standards-based single sign-on capabilities for web and mobile applications.

Security Fix(es):
* exposure of sensitive information in Pushed Authorization Requests (PAR) KC_RESTART cookie (CVE-2024-4540)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS
score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s)
listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat products and services.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat build of Keycloak 24.0.5 enhancement and security update

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: A flaw was found in Keycloak. Certain endpoints in Keycloak's admin REST API allow low-privilege users to access administrative functionalities. This flaw allows users to perform actions reserved for administrators, potentially leading to data breaches or system compromise.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: keycloak: Unguarded admin REST API endpoints allows low privilege users to use administrative functionalities
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat has evaluated this vulnerability. This affects only Keycloak server and no Keycloak clients library ship the affected code.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options don't meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

vulnerabilities.title: keycloak: Unguarded admin REST API endpoints allows low privilege users to use administrative functionalities

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: A flaw was found in Keycloak in OAuth 2.0 Pushed Authorization Requests (PAR). Client-provided parameters were found to be included in plain text in the KC_RESTART cookie returned by the authorization server's HTTP response to a `request_uri` authorization request, possibly leading to an information disclosure vulnerability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: keycloak: exposure of sensitive information in Pushed Authorization Requests (PAR) KC_RESTART cookie
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options don't meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.
